article: Last week after a long day of traveling, I found myself delayed at a bus station. The bus was running two hours late! I was a little _ and had to wait there reading a book. Just then a woman came up and asked me if I had any spare change to help her _ a bus ticket. "Oh, sure," I said. With the words, I reached into my bag for some _ . As I handed her five dollars I _ her stomach rumble and I knew she was very _ . I then reached back into my _ and brought out a Danish pastry I had bought earlier and _ it to her with a smile. She took the pastry and gave me a bus ticket to Milwaukee to show her _ . I don't live in Milwaukee and the ticket will probably _ be used, but I took it. A look of _ spread over her face. Then she went to get her _ and I went back to my _ . She came back a few _ later, apologized, and told me there were five dollars _ . I gave her the money and slipped a twenty as well . She thanked me and went back to the counter. _ I went back to my book. Five minutes later she came back again and _ to return my twenty. _ I said it was for her so she could get something else to eat and that I wasn't taking it back, she _ crying and hugged me. From then on, I always help others in trouble, because I believe I am really making a difference to them!
